compounddef.title: CELLSTR Convert character array to cell array of strings

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: The cellstr converts a character array matrix into a a cell array of individual strings. Each string in the matrix is placed in a different cell, and extra spaces are removed. The syntax for the command is y = cellstr(x) where x is an N x M array of characters as a string.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Here is an example of how to use cellstr

para.verbatim:
--> a = ['quick';'brown';'fox ';'is ']
a = quick brown fox is --> cellstr(a)
ans = [quick] [brown] [fox] [is]
